From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To temporarily set the ability of a line to act as a transparent pipe for file transfers for the current session, use the **terminal download** command in EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example configures a line to act as a transparent pipe:
ExtraInfo: You can use this feature to run a program such as KERMIT, XMODEM, or CrossTalk that downloads a file across an access server or router line. This command configures the terminal line to send data and is equivalent to entering all the following commands:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)terminal telnet transparent•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**terminal no escape-character**(see terminal escape-character)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**terminal no hold-character** (see terminal hold-character)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**terminal no padding 0**(see terminal padding)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**terminal no padding 128** (seeterminal padding)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)terminal parity none•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)terminal databits 8
